emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AIs capable of generating complete software solutions from high-level descriptions, reducing the need for extensive coding by humans.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to a significant shift in job markets for software developers, with new roles emerging in AI management and oversight.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on AI accuracy, security, and the ability to handle complex and nuanced programming tasks.

emerging_technologies.name: NeuraLink 2.0
emerging_technologies.description: An advanced brain-computer interface that allows for seamless control of digital devices and direct thought-to-text communication.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises significant ethical questions regarding privacy, security, and the nature of human interaction.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires overcoming public skepticism, regulatory approval, and ensuring the technology is safe and non-invasive.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: A blockchain system designed to withstand attacks from quantum computers, ensuring long-term security for digital transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in digital transactions, but might require significant updates to existing blockchain networks.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on the development pace of quantum computing and the readiness of current blockchain systems to integrate these updates.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Drone Delivery Networks
emerging_technologies.description: Network of drones capable of delivering goods autonomously, reducing delivery times and human intervention.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential job displacement in delivery services, changes in urban airspace regulations, and increased efficiency in logistics.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, public safety concerns, and the need for sophisticated air traffic management systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: Developers regularly collaborate with AI systems in real-time, enhancing productivity and code quality.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech companies and educational institutions, with tools becoming standard in software development environments.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart City Infrastructure
mainstream_technologies.description: Urban infrastructure utilizing IoT, AI, and big data for efficient resource management, traffic control, and public services.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Incorporated into city planning globally, with significant investments from both public and private sectors.

epoch_themes.description: A period marked by the pervasive integration of AI into daily life, work, and infrastructure.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Significant shifts in job markets, new regulatory frameworks, and potential for increased economic efficiency but also inequality.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, education reform to include AI literacy, and international collaboration on AI standards.

epoch_themes.description: Advances in technology aimed at making cities more sustainable, efficient, and self-managing.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improved quality of life, reduced urban congestion, but also challenges related to privacy and data security.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for green technology, urban planning innovations, and the rise of 'smart' communities.
